column5: This schema represents the header of a data transaction.
The identifier of this data point. We strongly recommend this to be a globally unique value.
column11: concatenation of  header.schema_id.name = 'heart-rate'  + '-' + body.descriptive_statistic  for example= heart-rate-maximum
column12: |2.1|header.id||concatenation of  header.schema_id.name = 'heart-rate'  + '-' + body.descriptive_statistic  for example= heart-rate-maximum|

column5: The date time this data point was created on the system where data is stored.
The schema identifier of the body of the data point.
The namespace of the schema. A namespace serves to disambiguate schemas with conflicting names.

Map header.schema_id.name to column "Observation.code.code" using  the [data_point_mapping_table](#)

Map header.schema_id.name to column "Observation.code.display" using  the [data_point_mapping_table](#)

column5: The version of the schema, e.g. 1.0.
A URL to retrieve the schema. If a URL is not specified, it is assumed that the schema can be located using other means.
The name of the source of the data.
The identifier of this data point at the source (immediately preceding step)
The date time (timestamp) of data creation at the source.
The date time (timestamp) of last data modification at the source
sensed' | 'self-reported'  The modality whereby the measure is obtained.
The user this data point belongs to.
